content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “g of x.” The data are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 2. g of x is negative 3. Column 2. x is negative 1. g of x is 2. Column 3. x is 0. g of x is 1. Column 4. x is 1. g of x is 0. Column 5. x is 2. g of x is 5." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.8em" equalrows="false" frame="solid" framespacing="0.4em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Selected values of a function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></math> are shown in the table above. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 comma 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 minus negative 2, and denominator 5 minus negative 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 5 minus negative 3, and denominator 2 minus negative 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 5 plus negative 3, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 3 plus 2, plus 1, plus 0, plus 5, and denominator 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 5 minus negative 3, and denominator 2 minus negative 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
